This is C# test Easy 1.
A: this is good\nB: what\'s for dinner.
Python is a ....

A: High-level language
B: Low-level language
C: Poisonous spider
D: Mid-level language.
Which of the following is a correct \'if\' statement?
Which of the following is a Python Keyword?

A: new
B: malloc
C: true
D: True
Which of the following is a Python Keyword?

A: new
B: switch
C: yield
D: switch
" Which of the following operator creates a pointer to a variable in C#?"

"A: sizeof
 B: typeof
 C: *
 D: ampersand"
Which of the following is correct about variable naming conventions in C#?

"A: A name must begin with a letter that could be followed by a sequence of letters, digits (0 to 9) or underscore
 B: The first character in an identifier cannot be a digit
 C: Both of the above
 D: None of the above"
" Which of the following access specifier in C# allows a class to expose its member variables and member functions to other functions and objects in the current assembly??"

"A: Public
 B: Private
 C: Protected
 D: Internal"
"Which of the following converts a type to a small floating point number in C#?

"A: ToInt64
 B: ToSbyte
 C: ToSingle
 D: None of the above"
"Which of the following property of Array class in C# gets a 32-bit integer, the total number of elements in all the dimensions of the Array?"

"A: Rank
 B: LongLength
 C: Length
 D: None of the above"
"Which of the following is the default access specifier of a class member function?? "

"A: Public
 B: Private
 C: Protected
 D: Internal"
"Which of the following is true about exceptions in C#?"

"A:The exception classes in C# are mainly directly or indirectly derived from the System.Exception class
 B: C# exceptions are represented by classes
 C: Both of the above.
 D: None of the above"
"Does C# support multiple inheritance"

"A: Yes
 B: No
 C: Sometimes
 D:When it feels like it"
"Which of these is not a way to declare variables in JavaScript?"

"A: let
 B: const
 C: int
 D: var"
"What's a primary use of JavaScript?

"A: Styling the Page
 B: Serving as a Database
 C: Scripting
 D: Making the Page Interactive"
"How do I access the value of a key in an object?"

"A: myVal = Obj.key
 B: myVal = Obj.val
 C: Object.keys(Obj).val 
 D: None of the above"
"What's another name for JavaScript?

"A: TypeScript
 B: React
 C: ECMAScript
 D: None of the above"
"How many variable keywords use variable hoisting?"
"What does .split('') do in JavaScript? "

"A: Makes each character in a string an element in an array
 B: removes all spaces from a string
 C: removes all spaces from the end of a string
 D: makes each element in an array part of the same string"
"What is an advantage of the React JavaScript framework?"

"A:Better styling options
 B: fast transitions/page loading
 C: no need for vanilla JavaScript
 D: None of the above"
"How do you convert a nodelist into an array in JavaScript?"

"A: myArr = Array.this(nodelist)
 B: myArr = Array.to(nodelist)
 C: myArr = Array.from(nodelist)
 D:myArr = Array.convert(nodelist)"
JS easy 1
A: this is good\nB: what\'s for dinner.
